title: High School Football: 2015
text:
Comment Houston County works to rebound from one-win season 
CLARKSVILLE, Tenn. A year after winning only one game and with a roster of only about 19 players, Houston County's expectations may have been low if you talk to the prep football pundits around the Midstate. 
But Brandon Clark always had faith that if he could produce the roster numbers, and the injury bug stayed away, not only could he improve on that one-win season in 2014 but he could also make a run for the Class A playoffs. 
Houston County's Nolas Seay runs around the end against Stewart County during a game earlier this season. The Irish face Perry County Friday night. (Photo: George Robinson/The Leaf-Chronicle) 
"We've been fortunate staying away from the injuries," Clark said. "A lot of that has to do with having an older team. We're mostly a senior and junior-led team and sometimes injuries come because you have freshmen and sophomores who are still learning how to develop high school football bodies in the weight room. But we've been lucky so far this season." 
Clark spent last spring trying to bulk his roster and when the summer hit, he had more than 50 players on the team. Those players have stuck around and the injury bug hasn't decimated the Fighting Irish like in years past. 
Subsequently, Clark's Houston County team is in the thick of the Class A playoff chase as it plays host to Perry County at 7 p.m. Friday night in Erin.
